title: Baby Spinach Omelet Recipe
description: Make this delicious spinach omelet with baby greens, Parmesan cheese, and a little nutmeg for a simple and quick meal — perfect for any time of day.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Omelet Recipes Baby Spinach Omelet 4.5 (379) 281 Reviews 64 Photos Enjoy this spinach omelet with tender baby greens, Parmesan cheese, and a little nutmeg cooked together for the perfect start to the day. Submitted by HOLLYJUNE Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 64 64 64 64 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts France C Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 eggs 1 cup torn baby spinach leaves 1 ½ tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese ¼ teaspoon onion powder ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg salt and pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat eggs in a bowl, and stir in baby spinach and Parmesan cheese. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season with onion powder, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spray a small skillet with cooking spray and place over medium heat. Once warm, add in the egg mixture and cook until partially set, about 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Flip with a spatula, and continue cooking, 2 to 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to low and continue cooking, 2 to 3 minutes, or until omelet reaches desired doneness. Serve warm and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 436 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 186 Calories 12g Fat 3g Carbs 16g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 186 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 5g 23% Cholesterol 379mg 126% Sodium 279mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 1g Protein 16g 33% Vitamin C 9mg 9% Calcium 169mg 13% Iron 3mg 15% Potassium 317mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Baby Spinach Omelet 01 of 64 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 64 Photo by  Marvin 11/11/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Perfect as it is ! Loved it :-) Sometimes I change Parmesan for grated swiss cheese ;P 03 of 64 Photo by  ProudStew1484 02/17/2023 Very delicious and easy to follow! I didn't have real parmasan so I used the powdered kind instead. I added taco sauce to mine & ate it with berries. Very good & nice texture. 04 of 64 Photo by  Gabriel Emerson 05/31/2022 It tastes good, and it's quite simple, with minimal cleanup needed! 05 of 64 Photo by  hungrycollegekid 09/26/2021 I made an account just to review this thing. #1, I'd recommend cooking the spinach down instead of just putting it in the omelette raw like the recipe says. It'll taste a lot better instead of being a weird, sad texture. #2, apparently nutmeg and spinach is a Thing. I think it's gross. Would not recommend. #3, Maybe my eggs were just small but I wish I had used 3 instead of 2. But, if you have common sense you should be able to judge if you need another egg based on the consistency. Overall, this omelette tasted a little bit like sadness and brought out all the wrong flavors. I'm probably gonna make it again. 06 of 64 Photo by  Elgie 03/12/2021 Tasty omelette. I followed some of the reviews suggestions and I sautéed onion with the baby spinach instead of using onion powder. Added a few mushrooms too and a little mozzarella on top. 07 of 64 Photo by  Lori Beyer 10/01/2020 08 of 64 Photo by  FrackFamily5 CACT 06/15/2020 The reason I’m giving this one 4 stars is the amount of spinach. 1 C torn, makes for a very awkward omelette. It’s too much 1/2 C would have been better. The saltiness of the cheese paired with the savory onion and floral nutmeg was so nice. 09 of 64 Photo by  Tori Gibson 05/04/2020 10 of 64 Photo by  Laugh247 04/11/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Cheese Omelette with Herbs 1 Rating Asparagus Omelet 8 Ratings Mini Frittatas 106 Ratings Zucchini and Eggs 117 Ratings Western Omelet 4 Ratings Ultimate Low-Carb Ham and Cheese Omelet for Two 2 Ratings Eggs Florentine 36 Ratings Tasty Low-Carb Egg and Vegetable Saute Egg Flipped Over 45 Ratings Egyptian Feta Cheese Omelet Roll 47 Ratings Air Fryer Souffle Egg Cups 3 Ratings Scrambled Tofu 83 Ratings Ham and Cheese Omelette 11 Ratings Skinny Girl Individual Omelets 3 Ratings Yummy Veggie Omelet 130 Ratings Low-Carb Bacon Spinach Egg Cups 123 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: HOLLYJUNE

Once warm, add in the egg mixture and cook until partially set, about 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Flip with a spatula, and continue cooking, 2 to 3 minutes.
